required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual World Training for Community Health Workers (CHW)
clinical_study.official_title: Reaching Racial/Ethnic Minority Communities to Support Healthy Lifestyle Change: Virtual World Training for Community Health Workers

brief_summary.textblock: Standard, effective, and scalable training models are needed to help equip community health workers in their community-based diabetes prevention awareness efforts. This study will tailor/adapt, implement, and evaluate an innovative internet-based virtual world model to remotely deliver a diabetes prevention awareness training program to community health workers.

detailed_description.textblock: Standard, effective, and scalable training models are needed to help equip community health workers in their community-based diabetes prevention awareness efforts. This study will tailor/adapt, implement, and evaluate an innovative internet-based virtual world model to remotely deliver a diabetes prevention awareness training program to community health workers. A sequential mixed-methods design is used to address these specific aims: 1. Use community-based participatory research methods to guide the overall study and inform tailoring and adaptation of our virtual world model to deliver the CHW training program; 2. Conduct a randomized pilot study to compare change in primary outcomes (0, 12 weeks) after the in-person versus virtual world delivery of the program; and 3. Conduct summative focus groups to gather information to refine the program and study methodology.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in content knowledge will be measured using the program Knowledge Questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Program content knowledge will be assessed using an adapted version of the original training program knowledge questionnaire. Scores represent the number of content questions answered correctly. Higher scores represent greater program knowledge.
Each CHW will be asked to prepare and deliver a brief presentation, including 3 standardized topic areas.

secondary_outcome.description: Eating habits will be assessed using the Visually-Enhanced Food Behavior Checklist.
Physical activity will be assessed with International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ).

other_outcome.measure: Change in self-efficacy and Stage of Change. A Self-Efficacy Index will be used and Stage of Change individual questions will be used for healthy eating and physical activity.
other_outcome.description: A multi-item index of self-efficacy will be used to examine confidence in making lifestyle changes and in delivering the content. Higher scores represent greater confidence. Stage of change questions will assess CHW motivation (i.e., pre-contemplation, contemplation, preparation) or achievement of eating habit and physical activity behaviors (i.e., action/maintenance stages).
Attendance will be measured by a count of the number of training sessions attended.

arm_group.description: Participants will take part in an 8 session training program delivered using a virtual world approach
Participants will take part in an 8 session training program delivered using an in person approach

intervention.description: The intervention will involve an 8 session/topic CHW training focused on raising awareness of diabetes prevention in the communities they serve. It will be delivered remotely using an internet based approach.

The intervention will involve an 8 session/topic CHW training program focused on raising awareness of diabetes prevention in the communities they serve. It will be delivered during in person sessions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- community health worker
- 18-65 years old
- Female
- Of African American/Black/African ancestry
- not getting 150 minutes of physical activity weekly and/or overweight
- residing in Chicago/driving distance to Chicago study site
- regular access to internet and computer
Exclusion Criteria:
